Department of Electrical, Computer and Software Engineering Dr. Shahram ShahbazPanahi Shahram ShahbazPanahi BSc, MSc, PhD (Sharif, Iran), PEng Professor Department of Electrical, Computer and Software Engineering Faculty of Engineering and Applied Science Contact information 2000 Simcoe Street North Oshawa, Ontario L1G 0C5 Office: ERC 3085 905.721.8668 ext. 2842 905.721.3370 (fax) shahram.shahbazpanahi@ontariotechu.ca Research topics Array processing Co-operative communications Detection and estimation Dynamic spectrum access Smart antennas Statistical signal processing Wireless communications Education PhD (Electrical Engineering, majored in Statistical Signal Processing), Sharif University of Technology, Tehran, Iran, 2001; MSc (Electrical Engineering, majored in Signal Processing and Communication Systems), Sharif University of Technology, Tehran, Iran, 1994; and BSc (Electrical Engineering, majored in Communications), Sharif University of Technology, Tehran, Iran, 1992. Courses Digital Signal Processing; Signals and Systems; Statistical Signal Processing; and Stochastic Processes. Research and expertise Work experience Professional activities Honours and awards Industrial: System Engineer, Emad Semicon Company, Tehran, Iran, 1999 to 2001; and Parstel Telecom Company, Tehran, Iran, 1996 to 1999. Academic: Visiting Scientist, 2003 to 2004, University of Duisbrug-Essen, Germany; McMaster University, Hamilton, Canada, Postdoctoral Fellow, Adjunct Professor, and Lecturer, 2001 to 2007; and Razi University, Faculty Memeber, Kermanshah, Iran, 1994 to 1996. Senior Area Editor for IEEE Signal Processing Letters (2014 – present); Associate Editor for IEEE Signal Processing Letters (2012-present); Associate Editor for Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)Transactions on Signal Processing (2007-2009) and (2009-2011); Associate Editor for IEEE Signal Processing Letters (2006-2008) and (2008-2010); Senior IEEE Member; Member of IEEE Signal Processing Society Sensor Array and Multichannel (SAM) Technical Committee (2008-2011) and (20011-2014) Symposium Chair for Emerging Areas, Canadian Conference on Electrical and Computer Engineering (CCECE) 2008; Professional Engineer of Ontario (2006-present); IEEE Student Branch Counsellor at Ontario Tech (2005-2011). Awarded Ontario Tech’s Junior Research Excellence Award; Awarded NSERC Discovery Grant 2011 to 2016; Awarded NSERC Discovery Grant 2006 to 2011; Received an Early Researcher Award from Ontario’s Ministry of Research and Innovation, 2010; Received the Research Excellence Award from the Faculty of Engineering and Applied Science, 2010; Elected as the Outstanding Graduate Student among all PhD graduates; Ranked 2nd in the PhD entrance exam out of 100 applicants; Ranked 1st among all Communications Engineering MS students out of 10 students; Ranked 7th among all Electrical Engineering students in the Iranian nation-wide MS entrance exam out of 200 applicants; Ranked 2nd among all Electrical Engineering undergraduate students out of 120 students; and Ranked 1st among all Communications Engineering students in the Iranian nation-wide BS entrance exam out of 25,000 applicants.
